VM101.name: Veterinary Medicine in Society
VM101.description: Role of the veterinary profession in animal and human health. Impact of veterinary medicine on society.

VM110.name: Veterinary Medical Terminology
VM110.description: Veterinary medical terminology, focusing on fundamental recognition, interpretation and usage of medical terms.

VM120.name: Veterinary Comparative Nutrition
VM120.description: Energy metabolism, nutrients and nutrient requirements of common domestic species.

VM130.name: Comparative Anatomy for Veterinary Nurses
VM130.description: Gross anatomy of the common animal species encountered in veterinary medicine. Overview of the functional anatomy of the musculoskeletal, digestive, cardiovascular, cutaneous, respiratory, urogenital, nervous, and endocrine systems and the special senses.
VM130.prerequisite: {(Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement) and (BS 161 and BS 171)} or LB 145

VM140.name: Pharmacology for Veterinary Nurses
VM140.description: Fundamentals of characteristics, classification and usage of veterinary pharmaceuticals. Introduction to and application of dosage and formulation calculations.
VM140.prerequisite: {(MTH 101 and MTH 103) or MTH 103} and (MTH 114 or MTH 116 or MTH 124 or MTH 132 or MTH 152H)

VM150.name: Hospital Procedures and Communication
VM150.description: Development of various modalities of professional and client communication skills.

VM155.name: Veterinary Nursing Careers and Professional Development
VM155.description: Career options in veterinary nursing, discussion of professional, ethical and legal considerations. Portfolio development, resume and cover-letter writing skills.

VM160.name: Small Animal Nursing Skills
VM160.description: Small animal nursing including principles of restraint, physical examination, medical management techniques, and behavior of common companion animals. Recognition of common canine and feline breeds.
VM160.prerequisite: VM 110 and VM 130 and VM 140 and VM 150

VM165.name: Large Animal and Laboratory Animal Nursing Care Techniques
VM165.description: Fundamentals of the handling of equine, food animal and laboratory animal species. Breed identification, specimen collection, physical exam, medication administration and other nursing care procedures relevant to the species.

VM170.name: Hematology and Immunology for Veterinary Nurses
VM170.description: Structure and function of normal blood cells, cellular and humoral immunity, mechanisms of hemostasis, blood group serology, transfusion medicine and vaccinology.

VM175.name: Clinical Pathology Laboratory I for Veterinary Nurses
VM175.description: Veterinary clinical pathology laboratory including diagnostic procedures in hematology, serology and ELISA methodology.

VM176.name: Clinical Pathology Laboratory II for Veterinary Nurses
VM176.description: Comprehensive veterinary clinical pathology laboratory, including diagnostic procedures in urology, dermatology, cytology, and advanced methods in hematology

VM205.name: Preventive Animal Health Care for Veterinary Nurses
VM205.description: Development of husbandry techniques to enhance wellness and reduce the risk of disease, injury and stress in common domestic and exotic animals.

VM210.name: Surgical Nursing for Veterinary Nurses
VM210.description: Role of the veterinary nurse as a member of the veterinary surgical team.

VM215.name: Surgical Nursing and Anesthetic Management Laboratory
VM215.description: Principles and techniques in veterinary surgical nursing and anesthesia.

VM245.name: Parasitology for Veterinary Nurses
VM245.description: Parasites of veterinary and public health importance, including gross and microscopic morphology, transmission, and control.

VM250.name: Veterinary Comparative Clinical Physiology
VM250.description: Function, regulation, and integration of organs and organ systems of common domestic species. Concepts with clinical relevance.
VM250.prerequisite: {(Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement) and (BS 161 and BS 171)} or LB 145

VM255.name: Small Animal Diseases and Management
VM255.description: Pathophysiology, transmission, diagnostic process, clinical management and prevention of canine and feline diseases.
VM255.prerequisite: VM 160 and VM 170 and VM 250 and VM 175

VM265.name: Dentistry Techniques for Veterinary Nurses
VM265.description: Veterinary dental techniques and oral cavity assessment for companion animals.

VM270.name: Advanced Skills Development for Veterinary Nurses
VM270.description: Service-oriented approach to health care development in an operational animal care facility.

VM275.name: Large Animal Diseases and Management
VM275.description: Diseases, husbandry, preventative health care and client education for equine and food animal species.

VM285.name: Clinical Nutrition for Veterinary Nurses
VM285.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
VM285.description: Nutritional assessment and management of common domestic species in veterinary medicine.

VM290.name: Special Studies in Veterinary Medicine
VM290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM290.description: Faculty-directed individual study on an experimental, theoretical or applied problem. May involve a supervised off-campus experience.

VM295.name: Biomedical Research and Regulatory Issues for Veterinary Nurses
VM295.description: Principles and techniques of biomedical research, governance and regulation of animal care and use.

VM303.name: Anesthesiology for Veterinary Nurses
VM303.description: Pharmacologic action of preanesthetic and anesthetic drugs. Principles and techniques of induction, maintenance, monitoring, and recovery of the patient. Humane methods of euthanasia.
VM303.prerequisite: VM 140 and VM 160 and VM 130 and VM 250

VM304.name: Radiology for Veterinary Nurses
VM304.description: Production of radiographs, components of the x-ray machine, use of screens and grids, handling film, imaging quality, film processing, patient positioning, and radiation safety.

VM305.name: Hospital Practice Management for Veterinary Nurses
VM305.description: Veterinary practice economics, personnel management, inventory control and marketing techniques.

VM337.name: Introduction to Foodborne Pathogens
VM337.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
VM337.description: Microbial classification, growth, genetics, epidemiology, transmission and ecology of major food and waterborne pathogens including bacteria, viruses, parasites, prions and protozoa.
VM337.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Food Safety Major or approval of department.

VM369.name: Introduction to Zoo and Aquarium Science
VM369.description: Fundamentals of zoo and aquarium operations including research, interpretation, design, nutrition, captive breeding, conservation, ethics and management.

VM410.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Anesthesiology
VM410.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM410.description: Application of principles and techniques in anesthesiology.
VM410.prerequisite: (VM 270 and VM 275 and VM 245 and VM 304) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

VM411.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Radiology
VM411.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM411.description: Application of principles and techniques in radiology.
VM411.prerequisite: VM 270 and VM 275 and VM 245 and VM 304

VM412.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Companion Animal Medicine
VM412.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM412.description: Application of principles and techniques in restraint, examination, nursing care, monitoring, and preventive medicine of companion animals.
VM412.prerequisite: (VM 270 and VM 275 and VM 245 and VM 304) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

VM413.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Companion Animal Surgery
VM413.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM413.description: Application of principles and techniques in surgical nursing.
VM413.prerequisite: VM 270 and VM 275 and VM 245 and VM 304

VM414.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Equine Medicine and Surgery
VM414.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM414.description: Application of principles and techniques in equine medicine and surgery.

VM415.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Food Animal and Equine Medicine and Surgery
VM415.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM415.description: Application of principles and techniques in food animal and equine medicine and surgery.

VM450.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Emergency Medicine
VM450.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM450.description: Application of principles and techniques in emergency medicine.

VM451.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Cardiology
VM451.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM451.description: Application of principles and techniques in cardiology.

VM452.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Neurology
VM452.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM452.description: Application of principles and techniques in neurology and physical therapy.

VM453.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Ophthalmology
VM453.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM453.description: Application of principles and techniques in ophthalmology.

VM454.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Critical Care
VM454.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM454.description: Application of principles and techniques in critical care.

VM455.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Companion Animal Oncology
VM455.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM455.description: Application of principles and techniques in companion animal oncology.

VM456.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Companion Animal Physical Rehabilitation
VM456.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM456.description: Application of principles and techniques of companion animal physical rehabilitation, particularly those animals recovering from orthopedic and neurologic injuries and surgeries.

VM458.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Companion Animal Diagnostic Ultrasound
VM458.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM458.description: Application of principles and techniques of Diagnostic Ultrasound

VM466.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Large Animal Anesthesia
VM466.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM466.description: Application of principles and techniques of food animal and equine anesthesiology.
VM466.prerequisite: VM 270 and VM 275 and VM 303 and VM 304

VM470.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Food Animal Medicine
VM470.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM470.description: Application of principles and techniques in food animal medicine.

VM480.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Clinical Pathology
VM480.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM480.description: Application of principles and techniques in clinical pathology.
VM480.prerequisite: VM 270 and VM 275 and VM 303 and VM 245

VM482.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Necropsy
VM482.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM482.description: Application of principles and techniques in postmortem examination of common domestic species with emphasis on specimen description, collection, and submission.
VM482.prerequisite: VM 270 and VM 275 and VM 303 and VM 245

VM483.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Biomedical Research
VM483.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM483.description: Application of principles and techniques in biomedical research involving laboratory animals.
VM483.prerequisite: VM 270 and VM 275 and VM 303 and VM 304 and VM 245

VM484.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Zoo and Wildlife Medicine
VM484.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM484.description: Application of principles and techniques in zoo and wildlife medicine.
VM484.prerequisite: VM 270 and VM 275 and VM 303 and VM 304 and VM 245

VM486.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Clinical Parasitology
VM486.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM486.description: Application of principles and techniques in clinical parasitology.

VM487.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Dermatology
VM487.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM487.description: Application of principles and techniques in dermatology.

VM490.name: Veterinary Nursing Clerkship in Special Problems
VM490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM490.description: Application of principles and techniques in experimental, therapeutic, or laboratory medicine.
VM490.prerequisite: VM 270 and VM 275 and VM 303 and VM 304 and VM 245

VM500.name: Veterinary Science I
VM500.description: Introduction to veterinary science. Evidence based medicine; host, animal and environmental interactions in health.
VM500.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM501.name: One Health I
VM501.description: Introduction to one health. Interrelationships among environmental, human, and non-human animal health. Health-professionals team approach to solving health problems.
VM501.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM502.name: Veterinary Doctoring I
VM502.description: Introduction to professionalism, basic communication skills, effective use of teams, medical ethics, health records, confidentiality, professional use of social media, and safe veterinary practices. Clinical doctoring skills, with emphasis on cutaneous, hematologic, immunologic, reproductive, and respiratory systems in health.
VM502.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM503.name: Veterinary Career and Practice Management I
VM503.description: Debt, budgets, financial risk assessment, financial planning, career development, work-life balance, and recognizing impaired physical or mental health and the need for professional help.
VM503.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM504.name: One Health II
VM504.description: Veterinary medicine and public health. Introduction to veterinary interactions with the public, including disaster response and crisis communication. Relevant laws, regulations, and regulatory agencies.
VM504.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM505.name: Veterinary Doctoring II
VM505.description: Professionalism, communication, medical ethics, and social competence, including professional interactions, client communication, history taking, and recognizing cultural differences and their impact. Clinical doctoring skills, with emphasis on cardiovascular, digestive, endocrine, musculoskeletal, nervous, and urinary systems in health.
VM505.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM506.name: Veterinary Career and Practice Management II
VM506.description: Health teams, leadership, workplace behavior, DVM job market, and the process of securing DVM employment.
VM506.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM507.name: One Health III
VM507.description: Social issues of relevance to animals and the veterinary community. Emphasis on issues related to cutaneous, hematologic, immunologic, reproductive, and respiratory systems.
VM507.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM508.name: Veterinary Doctoring III
VM508.description: Professionalism, communication, medical ethics, social competence, and clinical doctoring skills, with emphasis on issues and skills involving disorders of the cutaneous, hematologic, immunologic, reproductive, and respiratory systems.
VM508.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM509.name: Veterinary Career and Practice Management III
VM509.description: Veterinary business finance including financial statement literacy and ratio analysis. Cost-of-care estimates and their communication to clients. Giving and receiving feedback, building positive work relationships, conflict management.
VM509.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM510.name: One Health IV
VM510.description: Social and medical issues of relevance to animals and the veterinary community. Emphasis on issues related to cardiovascular, digestive, endocrine, musculoskeletal, nervous, and urinary systems.
VM510.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM512.name: Veterinary Doctoring IV
VM512.description: Professionalism, communication, medical ethics, social competence, and clinical doctoring skills, with emphasis on issues and skills involving disorders of the cardiovascular, digestive, endocrine, musculoskeletal, nervous, and urinary systems. Writing prescriptions, discharge instructions, and patient records. Managing emotions in work settings.
VM512.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM513.name: Ethical and Animal Welfare Issues in the Veterinary Profession
VM513.description: Identifying and communicating ethical challenges and animal welfare issues in the veterinary profession.
VM513.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM514.name: Comparative Lifestage Nutrition
VM514.description: Nutritional assessment and management of the physiological stages of growth. Adult maintenance, gestation, lactation, performance, and geriatric concerns of common domestic species.
VM514.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM515.name: Animals in Society
VM515.description: Role of animals and veterinary medicine in society. Intersections of animal behavior, animal welfare, ethics, public health and regulatory medicine.
VM515.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM516.name: Musculoskeletal System I
VM516.description: Structure and function of the musculoskeletal system in health.
VM516.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM517.name: Nervous System I
VM517.description: Structure and function of the nervous system in health.
VM517.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM518.name: Cardiovascular System I
VM518.description: Structure and function of the cardiovascular system in health.
VM518.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM519.name: Cutaneous System I
VM519.description: Structure and function of the cutaneous system in health.
VM519.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM520.name: Respiratory System I
VM520.description: Structure and function of the respiratory system in health.
VM520.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM523.name: Immunologic and Hematologic Systems I
VM523.description: Structure and function of the immunological and hematologic systems in health.
VM523.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM525.name: Digestive System I
VM525.description: Structure and function of the digestive system in health
VM525.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM527.name: Endocrine System I
VM527.description: Structure and function of the endocrine system in health.
VM527.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM528.name: Reproductive System I
VM528.description: Structure and function of the reproductive system in health.
VM528.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM529.name: Urinary System I
VM529.description: Structure and function of the urinary system in health
VM529.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM530.name: Veterinary Science II
VM530.description: Host, agent, environment interaction for disease causation.
VM530.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM531.name: Immunologic and Hematologic System II
VM531.description: Immunologic and hematologic disorders of animals.
VM531.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM532.name: Veterinary Integrative Problem Solving
VM532.description: Integration of subject material from concurrent and previous courses using a problem-based learning format.
VM532.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM533.name: Veterinary Epidemiology
VM533.description: Basic epidemiologic theory and study design. Veterinary descriptive and inferential biostatistics. Production veterinary medicine.
VM533.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM534.name: Cutaneous System II
VM534.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM535.name: Reproductive System II
VM535.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM536.name: Respiratory System II
VM536.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM537.name: Veterinary Career and Practice Management IV
VM537.description: Productivity and profitability, marketing, writing resumes and cover letters, interview strategies, professional development, and team selection, communication, and evaluation.
VM537.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM543.name: Cardiovascular Diseases
VM543.description: Cardiovascular diseases of domestic animals. Pathogenesis, diagnosis, and treatment.
VM543.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM544.name: Veterinary Public Health
VM544.description: Veterinary environmental, occupational, and public health. Milk and meat hygiene. Control of zoonotic diseases.
VM544.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM545.name: Principles of Anesthesia and Surgery
VM545.description: Administering anesthetic agents. Fundamentals of surgery including sterile technique, tissue handling, suture patterns, wound healing, and postoperative care.
VM545.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM546.name: Musculoskeletal Diseases
VM546.description: Musculoskeletal diseases of domestic animals. Pathogenesis, diagnosis, and treatment.
VM546.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM547.name: Respiratory Diseases
VM547.description: Respiratory diseases of domestic animals. Pathogenesis, diagnosis, and treatment.
VM547.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM549.name: Applied Diagnostic Imaging
VM549.description: Radiographic interpretation. Recognition of abnormalities. Development of verbal skills in image interpretation. Alternate imaging modalities.
VM549.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM553.name: Theriogenology and Urinary Diseases
VM553.description: Urogenital diseases of domestic animals. Pathogenesis, diagnosis, and treatment.
VM553.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM554.name: Hematological, Oncological and Dermatological Diseases
VM554.description: Hematological, oncological and dermatological diseases of domestic animals. Pathogenesis, clinical presentation, diagnosis, and treatment.
VM554.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM555.name: Neurological and Ophthalmological Diseases
VM555.description: Neurological and ophthalmological diseases of domestic animals. Pathogenesis, diagnosis, and treatment.
VM555.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM557.name: Operative Surgery
VM557.description: Soft tissue and orthopedic surgery of domestic animals. Preoperative evaluation, surgery, and postoperative care.
VM557.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM558.name: Digestive Diseases of Domestic Animals
VM558.description: Digestive diseases of domestic animals. Diagnosis, therapy, prophylaxis, and management.
VM558.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM559.name: Metabolic and Endocrinological Diseases
VM559.description: Pathogenesis, diagnosis, and treatment of metabolic and endocrinologic diseases of domestic animals.
VM559.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM561.name: Private Practice Ownership
VM561.description: Demographic studies, business entities, financing, leadership, business and marketing plans, and entrepreneurial ownership considerations when starting a practice or buying an existing practice.
VM561.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM565.name: Cardiovascular System II
VM565.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM568.name: Urinary System II
VM568.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM569.name: Musculoskeletal System II
VM569.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM571.name: Nervous System II
VM571.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM575.name: Digestive System II
VM575.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM577.name: Endocrine System II
VM577.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM611.name: Veterinary Externship
VM611.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM611.description: Clinical or research experience in an off-campus setting.
VM611.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM690.name: Special Problems in Veterinary Medicine
VM690.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
VM690.description: Individual study directed by a faculty member on an experimental, theoretical, or applied problem. May involve off-campus experience in a preceptorial mode.
VM690.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM692.name: Career Development and Business Skills
VM692.description: Development of leadership, business and interpersonal skills, career planning, and goal setting.
VM692.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM693.name: Companion Animal Behavior Clerkship
VM693.description: History acquisition, development of treatment plans in the context of veterinary behavior cases.
VM693.restrictions: Open to veterinary medicine students in the College of Veterinary Medicine or approval of college.

VM810.name: Food Safety Introduction and Professional Management
VM810.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM810.description: Various food safety topics. Organizational, managerial, leadership and communication skills.
VM810.restrictions: Open only to students in the Master of Science degree in Food Safety or approval of college.

VM811.name: Evolution and Ecology of Foodborne Pathogens
VM811.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM811.description: Evolution of foodborne pathogens. Ecology of microbial organisms found in the food chain from introduction through human consumption.
VM811.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Food Safety major or approval of college.

VM812.name: Food Safety Toxicology
VM812.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
VM812.description: Nature and properties of toxic substances through the food chain. Nature and magnitude of hazards to human health.
VM812.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Food Safety major or approval of college.

VM813.name: Special Studies in Food Safety
VM813.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM813.description: Faculty supervised independent study on an experimental, theoretical or applied project. May involve on-campus or off-campus experience.
VM813.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Food Safety major or approval of college.

VM814.name: Packaging for Food Safety
VM814.description: Current issues in packaging and food safety.
VM814.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Food Safety major and open to graduate students in the Packaging major or approval of college.

VM815.name: Applied Project in Food Safety
VM815.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM815.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Food Safety major or approval of college.

VM817.name: Livestock Pre-Harvest Food Safety
VM817.description: Principles for improvement of pre-harvest food safety. Emphasis on microbial, chemical, and toxic hazards. Strategies to reduce pre-harvest risks in many food production species.
VM817.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Food Safety Major or approval of college.

VM820.name: Current Topics in Comparative Medicine and Integrative Biology
VM820.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
VM820.description: Topics in comparative medicine using recently published literature to illustrate concepts.
VM820.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

VM821.name: Food Protection and Defense
VM821.description: Food systems and criminal justice approaches to prepare for and solve issues relating to food safety and defense.
VM821.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Veterinary Medicine or in the Food Safety major or in the Veterinary Medicine major or in the Criminal Justice major or approval of college.

VM824.name: Global Food Safety
VM824.description: Understanding food safety challenges in different geographic regions. Development of interventions for food safety in a global context.
VM824.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Food Safety major or approval of college.

VM825.name: Quantifying Food Risk
VM825.description: Food risks based on quality, safety, fraud and intentional threats.
VM825.restrictions: Open to master's students or graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine or in the School of Criminal Justice or in the School of Packaging or in the Food Safety major or approval of college.

VM826.name: Creating a Food Safety Culture
VM826.description: Explores proven, evidence-based ways to change or strengthen the food safety culture of an organization and influence employee behavior.

VM827.name: Food Safety Modernization Act and Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Point Systems
VM827.description: Food safety requirements for food establishments subject to the Food Safety Modernization Act. Food safety management systems, with a focus on the Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP) Approach.
VM827.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Food Safety Major or approval of college.

VM830.name: Food Safety Research Methods
VM830.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
VM830.description: Conducting and interpreting food safety research. Interpretation and critique of the literature, study design, and communication of food safety research.
VM830.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Veterinary Medicine or approval of college.

VM831.name: Foodborne Disease Epidemiology for the Professional
VM831.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
VM831.description: Applied foodborne disease investigation through the use of case studies.
VM831.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Food Safety major or approval of college.

VM834.name: Current Issues in Food Safety
VM834.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
VM834.description: Allergen control in the manufacturing setting, microbial control in the manufacturing setting, good manufacturing practices, ingredient safety, preventative control, produce food safety and other topics as needed.
VM834.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Veterinary Medicine or in the Department of Large Animal Clinical Sciences or in the Food Safety Major or approval of college.

VM835.name: Food Safety for Produce
VM835.description: Overview of food safety requirements for the produce sector with a focus on Good Agriculture Practices (GAPS).
VM835.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Food Safety Major or approval of department.

VM836.name: Food Safety Issues by Commodity
VM836.description: Food safety issues specific to different commodity groups or segments of food industry including meat safety, dairy safety, beverage safety, pet food safety, ingredient safety, and food waste recovery.
VM836.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Veterinary Medicine or in the Food Safety Major or approval of college.

VM840.name: Anti-Counterfeit Strategy and Product Protection
VM840.description: Theory and applied techniques for anti-counterfeit strategies and product protection for food and consumer products.
VM840.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the School of Criminal Justice or in the School of Packaging or in the Food Safety major or approval of department.

VM844.name: Food Fraud Prevention
VM844.description: Theory and applied techniques for food fraud prevention strategies.
VM844.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Veterinary Medicine or in the Department of Large Animal Clinical Sciences or in the Food Safety Major or approval of college.

VM899.name: Master's Thesis Research
